LOL "BORT" what is that? *wink*

Misspelled boat

so.... battle then?

Yes. I have an array of Ground Forces, Check them out on my page. I would like to use all of them so I can test them. Would you like to set up? or should I set up? My battlecrafts are mostly high part count so they should be far from each other. I can only place three of them at the same place at one time without much lag. They should be setup in groups of three.

I found your file and I will setup my tanks it the one with the two tanks near KSC right?

May i join?

My computer can't handle more than 400 parts, but i'd love to engage in some low-part battles! I have some pretty good under-100-part ships that i'd like to put to the test!

Yeesh, I've got some missiles that are 50 parts apiece. XD

But yeah, you can join! Just set a battle up, or try joining one if someone else offers.

This tank has been tested by Kerdinand on KODI using BD Armory, here is his review: click here for the link here if you like "Armor Test on the Maelstrom"

I will quote him:

"Today I tested the armor of the Maelstrom against BD armory weapons, and I thought IÃ‚Â´d give you a small review.

The tanks cockpit remained intact even after firing all my missiles and the weaponry and outer cockpit also survived some shots. The main hull seems to be almost undestroyable. I have to say this is one of the best armors IÃ‚Â´ve ever seen. But in my opinion it should be used for starships/bases only, because it contains massive clipping. Already the first shot made the vehicle undriveable because the armor clipped in each other, the wheels clipped themselves and popped and the whole vehicle shaked so much, attacked by Kraken Corps heraldic animal, that I werenÃ‚Â´t able to drive, aim or even control it anymore."

Conclusion: An excellent armor, that canÃ‚Â´t be destroyed but made useless by BD weapons."

I might just have to make a simple INS Kolkata Destroyer replica.
Would someone please shoot something already

Yeah, i actually built the Reed with your type hull - a truss running down the bottom and then it comes up and around - it's very strong, somewhat more part efficient, and provides huge amounts of buoyancy (the ship i sitting 2m higher than the waterline!)

Only downside is that it is really draggy - top speed with two nuclear reactors is 3.2 m/s. with some jets i boost it to about 10, but that's only for combat speed.

But for being a hybrid stealth destroyer, that's pretty good. I'm happy with it.

http://i.imgur.com/HGNs70M.png

can someone please tell me what nuclear drives are???

can someone please tell me what nuclear drives are???

Very intricate rotating things with wings spammed all over them that abuse the physics engine to produce thrust for free*.

*Electricity, but we've got stuff for that.

Zekes, got any pictures? I can't find any.
I guess I could make "Nuclear Drives" too for my ships, I have a working bearing system from a Helicopter I made. I will combine airbreathing engines with a paddle cylinder with SAS on.

I guess I could make "Nuclear Drives" too for my ships, I have a working bearing system from a Helicopter I made. I will combine airbreathing engines with a paddle cylinder with SAS on.

It sounds simple, but it's hard to get right, trust me.

It sounds simple, but it's hard to get right, trust me.

Guess I need to start building then.

Bearing system from my unfinished Helicopter, Guess i need to make a variant of it sideways.

Edited February 21, 2015 by Zamovinar

can someone please tell me what nuclear drives are???

They're talking about the stock LV-N Atomic Rocket Motor.

They're talking about the stock LV-N Atomic Rocket Motor.

No, they're not.

This is an example of the rotor itself. You attach wings and SAS to it, spin it, and it gives you thrust.

To the Queen of Mars, Nein. To Starwhip, congrats because you got it right. It all works because the physics engine is high.

(Mods, you can snip the last joke out if you think that's going against the rules.)

Yes, thank you for the explosions.

Also, so it's not actually a nuclear drive so much as a stock electrical turbine, you could power it with solar panels if you chose.

Edited February 23, 2015 by Mr Tegu

http://i.imgur.com/qGFsq1W.png

No, they're not.

This is an example of the rotor itself. You attach wings and SAS to it, spin it, and it gives you thrust.

Why would they call that a nuclear drive when a nuclear drive already exists? smh
It's more in reference to nuclear reactors on navy ships...

Sorry, I have been neglecting this battle for quite sometime, I've been very busy on Kerbal Powers and Kerbal Evolution,

That file is broken, I can't save or anything, just as you said. Please upload a new one. It broke my game I had to recreate an entire save.

Been busy working on these.

ARMORED CAR

WEATHER SHIP (Don't ask why)

yes.... cmon man

KRAKEN TECHNOLOGIES present the MAELSTOM TANK: Unlike it's big brother the MAELSTROM ALPHA (Heavy Tank), the ordinary MAELSTROM TANK (Medium Tank) is the main battle tank of the KRKN KORPS.

Though compared to other tanks it may be classified as a heavy tank but it really is just a medium tank according to KRKN's standards.

It is a piece of marvelous engineering and very reliable. Completely amphibious in nature, it can transverse any terrain including water.

It is also very tough that it can survive considerable hits from BD armory weapons. Not to mention it can easily shrug off improvised mini rocket powered I-beam weaponry because its armor is composed of a Reactive Armor System with two layers of panel armor.

It's only weakness is that has no rotating turret compared to some tanks, but it is a good trade off considering it will be used for an actual battle.

I present to you this,

Rendered by Starwhip (You can ask him to render your crafts)
